alert.note: Alert for Oregon Lower Treasure Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 1:27PM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Payette, northern Canyon, northwestern Owyhee, southwestern Gem and east central Malheur Counties through 300 PM MDT... At 226 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Homedale, or 9 miles south of Parma, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Wilder around 230 PM MDT. Greenleaf and Huston around 240 PM MDT. Caldwell, Notus and Sand Hollow around 250 PM MDT. Middleton, Star and Letha around 300 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
